result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corey A Grant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Corey A Grant in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Corey A Grant.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pre-trial conference held. Defense counsel needs discovery but has an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT, level 4, for supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT within 24 hours of being released from custody.  
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 9/16/2022. 
IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JVW.

Defendant Corey A Grant in court.  Prosecuting attorney Catelin Ringersma in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 29 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/14/22 @ 2p
